user_question: How can CRISPR be used to enhance drought resistance in crops, and generate an image of a genetically modified drought-resistant plant?
final_answer: CRISPR can be used to enhance drought resistance in crops by targeting and modifying specific genes responsible for water retention and stress response. Image of a genetically modified drought-resistant plant generated. The DREB1A gene is an example that can be targeted.
